description.value:
If you have Vehicle Proficiency, you can use a vehicle in the following ways, so long as the vehicle can reasonably undertake these maneuvers. Options with the (M) icon can be used with mounts as if they are vehicles: 

  • (M) Evasive Maneuvers: As a reaction, you can give disadvantage on an attack made against a vehicle or mount that you are piloting.
  • Repair Vehicle: As a Rest Action, make an Intelligence (Craft) check. Restore the vehicle’s hit points by the result, so long as you have the parts.
  • (M) Speed Demon: With your expert knowledge of your vehicle or mount’s workings, you know how to push it just above its typical limits without causing any harm to it. Vehicles under your control move 1/4 faster, rounded up to the nearest 5ft.
  • Tune-Up: As a Long Rest Action, you can tune up a vehicle to give one of the following benefits. Should the vehicle take any damage, be used to travel for a cumulative full day, or travel over rough terrain for half the length, the benefit is removed.
    • Lubricate: Increase movement speed of vehicle by ¼ rounded up to the nearest 5 feet. In addition, reduce travel time by 1 day per 6 days of travel.
    • Reinforce: Increase the vehicle’s durability. Make an Intelligence (Craft) check, giving the vehicle temporary hit points equal to the result.
    • Weather Proof: Increase the vehicle’s resilience to one type of intense weather. Vehicles can add your Intelligence (Craft) modifier to checks relating to the vehicle avoiding the detriments of the weather.
    • Terrain Match: Prepare a vehicle for particularly intense weather, so long as you have fitting parts. Vehicles can add your Intelligence (Craft) modifier to checks relating to the vehicle traveling across rough terrain.
  • (M) Unnatural Driver: You do not have disadvantage when attempting to control or ride a vehicle or mount of unusual or unnatural design.
